CHAPTER 21 ■Religious Reasoning
Nonetheless, God is supposed to be active in time, such as when He causes
miracles or answers prayers. Not all Jews, Christians, and Moslems share all
of these claims about God, but they are accepted by traditional theologians.
The readings in this chapter are about the traditional Christian God.
